intro: Rourea harmandiana, commonly known as the Harmand's rourea, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and dense, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters, which are often surrounded by specialized bracts. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
